subject: Newbie best practice question
msgSnippet: The class that I wish to test keeps a private ArrayList. I expose the following... public ArrayList getList(); public void setList(ArrayList); public void
messageBody:
The class that I wish to test keeps a private ArrayList. I expose the following...

public ArrayList getList();
public void setList(ArrayList);
public void clearList();
public void inList(String);


I am ignoring the get and sets, because they are simple - but I want to test the clearList() and inList() code. The clear I am testing because it has some secondary effects instead of just calling the clear() function. The inList is shown below.


public void testInTransactionSet() {
bettingSession.clearTransactions();

ArrayList wagerList = new ArrayList();
for (int x = 0; x < 20; x++) {
WagerInfo wager = new WagerInfo();
wager.setTicketID("" + x);
WagerTransactionSet wagerSet = new WagerTransactionSet(wager);
wagerList.add(wagerSet);
}
bettingSession.setTransaction(wagerList);

boolean actualReturn = bettingSession.inTransactionSet("5");
assertEquals("return value", true, actualReturn);

actualReturn = bettingSession.inTransactionSet("1234");
assertEquals("return value", false, actualReturn);

actualReturn = bettingSession.inTransactionSet("BadXact");
assertEquals("return value", false, actualReturn);}


From a best practices viewpoint - do people clear any changes they make before they exit their test? I currently don't call the clear just before exit, but I was wondering if I should so that other tests are not affected by any artifacts that I leave laying around.



Chip
-----
"The reason the mainstream is thought of as a stream is because it's so shallow" --George Carlin
